message: @ericflo cool.. I guess it doesn't make too much sense to be getting double popups ;). I'll work on it.
@fcarriedo I'm using it and I love it! Thanks for writing it @fcarriedo :)
@fcarriedo One request: when I'm on the website private messaging with someone, I keep getting the popups.
@ericflo Thanks!
Just released a convore Chrome Extension... you can check it out here: https://chrome.google.com/extensions/detail/dmhfcoidfigfhmdcikgekmcjdbhejlpk
For the power users, it has keyboard navigation and actions a la vim-gmail
group/topic creation is on the baking
using it
digging it
does it have mark as read?
@locks I have that feature ready but I'm battling on how to put it and not clutter the UI.
@locks But right now it marks them as read as soon as you go into the messages.
@fcarriedo hm, I was half expecting clicking on "x unread" to do it
another minor thing: new messages need some kind of distinction, like a grey-er background
as since I'm pestering you, a bread-crumb style would be convenient, something like "<- Groups <- Topics"
add a little unread count to the icon and you've saved me a tab open :D
It will be great now I can update with out recompiling yayyayayayaya LOL
@italiano40 Thanks for being a great helpful early adopter.
@locks ok. I enabled 'x' to mark as 'all read' on selected topics and groups. It should be there as soon as your extension updates ;)
nice job @fcarriedo
The previous is the default behavior but you can customize your notification/tabbing settings by right clicking on the extension's rex icon and selecting 'options'.
let me know if there are any issues..
@ericflo Just put the feature in to prevent notifications from showing when convore's website is your focused active tab. It should be there once your browser upgrades to v0.9.7.7 of the extension.
@locks Added a color transition animation to distinguish the new messages from the old ones in the msgs pane on 0.9.7.8. Lets see how that works.
This is awesome. Great job.
images are opt-out by default but I'm not sure if youtube inline display should be opt-in or opt-out by default? I would appreciate your thoughts on this.
Just added support for youtube in version 0.9.8.
for those of you that don't want to have media displayed in the messages... you can customize your media display preferences on the extension's options.
BTW... no autoplay! =P
totally awesome!
support for 'youtu.be' URL shortened videos is coming tonight
It would be nice if clicking on the logo in the header would take you back to the list of groups. I kept clicking it expecting that to happen but it didn't.
@abraham I found myself the other day also trying to do that... so now, on the latest v, if you click in the main logo, it takes you to your home (groups pane).
@locks Added breadcrumbs for navigation and to give more context to the user in v0.9.8.2
youtu.be shortened urls are now supported. =).
